definition[0]: an office or organization that collects or provides information
definition[1]: a government department or a part of a government department in the US
definition[2]: an office of a company or organization that has its main office somewhere else
example[3]: the London bureau of the Washington Post
definition[3]: a large desk or writing table
definition[4]: a piece of furniture with several drawers, used to keep clothes in
definition[5]: an office, organization, or department that collects or gives out information
definition[6]: a government department or part of a government department
example[5]: the Federal Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms
definition[7]: an office of a company or organization that is not its main office or base
example[6]: The international environmental organization Greenpeace has established its own Moscow bureau.
